title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A novel about racial injustice in the Deep South, seen through the eyes of a young girl.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel that explores the dangers of totalitarianism and oppressive regimes.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A story of the mysterious millionaire Jay Gatsby and his obsession with the beautiful Daisy Buchanan.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A classic novel about the manners and matrimonial machinations among the British gentry of the early 19th century.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A novel about a disenchanted teenager, Holden Caulfield, and his experiences in New York City.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A fantasy adventure about Bilbo Baggins' journey to help a group of dwarves reclaim their homeland.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A novel set in a futuristic world where society is engineered for maximum happiness and stability.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: An epic tale of Captain Ahab's obsessive quest to kill the white whale, Moby Dick.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A high fantasy epic following the quest to destroy a powerful ring and defeat the Dark Lord Sauron.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A philosophical novel about a shepherd's journey to find his personal legend and fulfill his dreams.
